intro: Conophytum proximum, commonly known as the "Bottleplant," is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid environments. Its flowers, which appear in spring, are usually yellow or orange and are borne on short, hairy stalks. Conophytum proximum is popular among succulent enthusiasts due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
